sentence.idiomatic: He is very knowledgeable about robots.
Why is water pouring out of here? I had better go look into it.
To see whether or not this project is feasible we need to do some more research.
Medical science is so advanced now, his illness can definitely be cured.
The manufacturing industry in this area is really flourishing.
Relative to the surrounding areas, this city's economy is still not very developed.
When train speeds increase, it cuts down greatly on travel time.
You've got so many programs open, no wonder your computer is functioning more and more slowly.
The orbit of the moon around the earth is elliptical.
As soon as the teacher asked me about it, I almost gave away that I faked sick to stay home from school.

word.literal: he who talks much errs much

sentence.idiomatic: The more you talk the more you err. Say less, then you won't be giving things away.
Those few wanted to gang up on me and fool me, but one of them gave it away as soon as he opened his mouth.
Do you like sitting here with me on the beach looking at the stars?
Uh...
I study the stars. Do you know what that is over on the right?
What is it?
Mercury. Actually, you don't even need a telescope. You can see all the planets with your naked eye.
Really? You can even see Neptune?
Of course. Look where I'm pointing. That's it right there.
I recall that you can only see a few planets that are relatively close to earth. Like, Jupiter, Venus, Mars, and Saturn.
That was before. Now science has developed, and we can see them all.
I think that is wrong. Also, the planets in our solar system can not be seen every day. You need to wait until they are on the same place on its orbit.
Uh...Hey, do you know why I like stargazing?
How would I know?
Because they twinkle, just like your eyes.
Hmph. Really?
I really want to hold you in my arms and count the stars with you.

word.literal: to be unable to bear it
to not be able to see

sentence.idiomatic: That's it! I can't take it anymore! Not one sentence you said was correct, and today you can't see one single planet.
I'm finished! I've been found out!
